questions.question_text: A department manager submits a help desk ticket to request the migration of a printer's port utilization from USB to Ethernet so multiple users can access the printer. This will be a new network printer, thus a new IP address allocation is required. Which of the following should happen immediately before network use is authorized?

choices.A: Document the date and time of the change.
choices.C: Determine the risk level of this change.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Order of change management phases:
1. Request forms
2. Purpose of change
3. Scope of the change
4. Date and Time of the change
5. Affective systems/ impact
6. Risk analysis
7. Change board approval
8. Finally end user acceptance.

You would do #6 before #7. This question says "immediately" stating what is the step to be taken RIGHT BEFORE it is allowed on the network (approved). I'm going with Risk analysis - C.

comments.content: On further review - a change request form has not been filed yet. That is step 1.
I tend to agree - however - shouldn't you technically do #4 first? It comes before #6 and wasn't mentioned that it has been done yet. Sounds like CompTIA trying to "get" us.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I meant c

Selected Answer: D
Risk comes before request

Selected Answer: C
I believe the key word here is "immediately before network use is authorized"

This implies we are at the end of the change management process, which should involve risk analysis and then approval.
Why not B ? Please explain

Selected Answer: D
Other options may be applicable as part of the network change process, but they are not the first steps before allowing a new printer to use the network.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

Selected Answer: C
Check risk first, then change request.

Selected Answer: B
change request first before anything else

Selected Answer: C
The logical step is to understand the risks associated with the change, what precautions need to be taken and what steps are necessary to mitigate risk.

The change request form should have all the info needed for the board to make an approval no? So you determine the risk level before you submit the request as the risks should be in the request form. Or do you submit the request and after approval you do the assesment? Doesn't sound logical. I will go for C here.

Selected Answer: B
Change request

questions.question_text: An IT security team is implementing a new Group Policy that will return a computer to the log-in after three minutes. Which of the following best describes the change in policy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It’s B, screen lock.

Selected Answer: B
B. Screen lock

This policy is often associated with the screen lock timeout, where the computer automatically locks itself and returns to the log-in screen after a certain period of inactivity.

Selected Answer: D
- On macOS, applications are typically packaged as .app bundles, which appear as a single file to the user but contain all the necessary components to run the application.

- These are the standard and most common format for installing and launching software on macOS.

Why the other options are incorrect:
A. .deb – Used for Debian-based Linux distributions (like Ubuntu), not macOS.
B. .vbs – A Windows scripting file (VBScript), not compatible with macOS.
C. .exe – A Windows executable, does not run on macOS without special tools.

Selected Answer: D
The question says installing software so it has to be .app
I like that they pick .app over .dmg normies

Selected Answer: D
On Macs, installer files usually have the extension . pkg (not to be confused with application packages, which usually have the extension . app ). Installers are executable files that you can launch by double-clicking on their icon (which may look like a little package).

A+ Directive 1.10 The wording in the question is a bit misleading but since the install process has already started it would be recognised as an .app file. Before the file is installed it would show as a .pkg file. See Professor Messor Comptia A+ 220-1102 Training Course.

The file type that a technician is most likely to use when installing new software on a macOS computer is D. .app.

An .app file is a type of file that contains a packaged application that can be installed on a macOS computer. It contains all of the necessary files and resources that are needed to run the application, and it is designed to be easy to install and use.

On the other hand, .deb is a file format used by the Debian Linux distribution to distribute and install software packages. .vbs is a file extension for VBScript files, which are scripts written in the Visual Basic Scripting language, and .exe is a file extension for executable files in Windows operating systems. These file types are not typically used for installing software on a macOS computer.

Selected Answer: D
A is used in Linux, B and C are used in Windows, and D is used in MacOS for installed apps. It's D, everyone.

Selected Answer: D
It's D
https://www.file-extensions.org/mac-os-x-file-extensions
Actually, none of the provided options is a valid answer.

comments.content: for real, but D the only one that makes sense

questions.question_text: A technician is installing new software on a macOS computer. Which of the following file types will the technician MOST likely use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: EG
The security incident involving a USB drive installing malware on a workstation suggests a potential vector for unauthorized access. To prevent such incidents from happening again, consider the following actions:

E. Disable AutoRun:

Disabling AutoRun prevents the automatic execution of programs from USB drives when they are inserted into a computer. This helps in mitigating the risk associated with malicious software that might be automatically executed.
G. Restrict user permissions:

Restricting user permissions ensures that users have the minimum necessary privileges to perform their tasks. This can limit the impact of malware by reducing the permissions available to it. Users should not have unnecessary administrative privileges.

Can Someone explain why would it be G, Restrict user permissions? The question says the virus was covertly installed that basically means without the users interaction and knowledge. Yes restricting a users permissions can aid in reducing adware but if you plug in a malicious USB thumb drive you can still infect your computer even without running it. All adware is different so the next best thing would be F, Update the adware definitions. So even if you restrict them from opening it, some adware will still install just by being simple plugged in, example is a keylogger.

Selected Answer: EG
It’s E and G.

questions.question_text: A company recently experienced a security incident in which a USB drive containing malicious software was able to covertly install malware on a workstation. Which of the following actions should be taken to prevent this incident from happening again? (Choose two.)

A hard drive that previously contained PII needs to be repurposed for a public access workstation. Which of the following data destruction methods should a technician use to ensure data is completely removed from the hard drive?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. All other options will destroy the hdd therefore it won’t be able to be repurposed.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Can hard drives be reused after degaussing?
After degaussing hard drives, these cannot be reused. The reason being, in addition to removing data or making it unreadable, degaussing also removes the Start up files. Consequently, the degaussed hard drives do not boot up.

https://www.cybrary.it/blog/how-to-erase-a-hard-drive-and-reuse-for-good#:~:text=After%20degaussing%20hard%20drives%2C%20these,drives%20do%20not%20boot%20up.

After degaussing hard drives, these cannot be reused. The reason being, in addition to removing data or making it unreadable, degaussing also removes the Start up files.
https://www.cybrary.it/blog/how-to-erase-a-hard-drive-and-reuse-for-good#:~:text=After%20degaussing%20hard%20drives%2C%20these,removes%20the%20Start%20up%20files.

comments.content: Wrong, degaussing is a method of permanently rendering an HDD unusable.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
REPURPOSE MEAN to use something for a different purpose to the one for which it was originally intended.

by shredding they will destroy de item, and low level formatting wouldn't delete the data completely as it can always be recover so i say B degaussing because all data will be deleted and they can still use the drive for whatever

Selected Answer: A
answer is A

Selected Answer: B
Degaussing
C. TO ALLOW IT BE REUSED

Selected Answer: B
It's B because in the question it ask for delete the data permanently AND Degaussing is a method of permanently erasing data from working and non-working hard drives, tape, and floppy disks. Degaussing completely sanitizes the media of data in seconds by delivering a powerful magnetic pulse that instantly destroys all magnetic domains on the disk platters.

comments.content: No, degaussing will make it un-useable. They need to reuse the drive. If the question said "they DO NOT need to reuse the drive..." then degaussing (B) would be the answer all day. In this case, the answer is C - Low level.

discussion.content: Shouldn't it be B?
